ygData.subject: Re: Jig and Mana Regeneration
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: Blitz Krieg  To: eqbards@onelist.com  Date: Sunday, June 20, 1999 11:07 AM Subject: Re: [eqbards] Jig
ygData.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: Blitz Krieg <blitz_krieg@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Sunday, June 20, 1999 11:07 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Jig and Mana Regeneration


>From: "Blitz Krieg" <blitz_krieg@...>
>
>Alot of people just don't seem to understand just what a Bard can give to a
>party. They think either think that a Bard sucks as a tank, or sucks at a
>healer, or sucks at something else, and there's always someone that could
do
>something better than a Bard! I recently tried to discuss the advantages
of
>a Bard in a party with some guy on the EQVault board, but he really didn't
>want to understand what I was saying about the advantages of Bards. Alot
of
>people have their own ideas on things, sometimes something happened to them
>once, and they think it's a fact from that point onward, sometimes they
just
>like to believe in superstition. The thread on the boat crashing and it
>being Bard's fault is one example.
>


I read that thread, the guy simply didn't have a clue. You pointed it out
time and again that the bigger the group, the more effective a bard is,
and he just refused to see it. I held off jumping in because he had made
up his mind, and no amount of discussion was going to change it.

Tindayen
(Povar)
